+
On [[March 28]], 2007, Dell announced that it would begin shipping some desktops and laptops with Linux pre-installed, although it did not specify which distribution of Linux or which hardware would lead.<ref>http://www.dell.com/content/topics/global.aspx/ideastorm/ideasinaction?c=us&l=en&s=gen</ref> On [[April 18]], 2007 a report appeared suggesting that Michael Dell used [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]] on one of his home systems.<ref>{{cite web
